pull.title: test: Handle functional test disk-full error
pull.body:
Fixes: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/23099

Handle disk-full more gracefully in functional tests

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29335).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.

events.message: test: Handle functional test disk-full error

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,9 @@
 
 os.environ["REQUIRE_WALLET_TYPE_SET"] = "1"
 
+# Should fail testing and immediately stop if free space falls below.
+MIN_FREE_SPACE = (50 + 16) * 1024 * 1024

@@ -639,6 +642,11 @@ def run_tests(*, test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir, jobs=1, enable_coverage=
                     logging.debug("Early exiting after test failure")
                     break
 
+                testdir_disk_usage_stats = shutil.disk_usage(testdir)
+                if (testdir_disk_usage_stats.free < MIN_FREE_SPACE):
+                    logging.debug("Not space enough on device: %s" % testdir)
comments.body: nit: In python the `()` are not needed. Also, could use f-strings?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,9 @@
 
 os.environ["REQUIRE_WALLET_TYPE_SET"] = "1"
 
+# Should fail testing and immediately stop if free space falls below.
+MIN_FREE_SPACE = (50 + 16) * 1024 * 1024
comments.body:
I based the values based on the discussions on  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23100#issuecomment-941115724 and  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23100#discussion_r716825510 and 
![Screenshot from 2024-01-28 15-08-25](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/assets/15610188/414654c7-f8de-425d-aab3-ee95230f2524)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -639,6 +642,11 @@ def run_tests(*, test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir, jobs=1, enable_coverage=
                     logging.debug("Early exiting after test failure")
                     break
 
+                testdir_disk_usage_stats = shutil.disk_usage(testdir)
comments.body: I wonder if the check could be done upfront, to not even run any test, if it is unclear whether the device will even hold enough to run the tests.

comments.body: What is the total size of the directory when no test dir is cleaned up and all tests are run?
